maze.logic

Class Maze

  • java.lang.Object
    • maze.logic.Maze
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that represents all "maze" type objects. A maze consists, very shortly, in a series of tiles (chars) placed in a matrix. It has a size (actually, the matrix is SIZExSIZE) an it has an exit (instance of an Element with the symbol 'S') This class implements serializable, has it is used upon game saving.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Default Constructor.

      • Maze

        public Maze(int size)
        Constructor for Maze. The game maze is generated randomly.
        Parameters:
        size - : size of the maze to be built (eg: 7 means a 7x7 maze)

        Constructor for Maze. The game maze is received has a parameter.
        Parameters:

        public void generate()

        public int getSize()
        Gets the value of the parameter [size].
        Returns:
        the size of the maze

      • getExit

        public Element getExit()
        Gets the exit of the maze.
        Returns:
        the Element [Exit]

      • setExit

        public void setExit(Element exit)
        Sets the exit of the maze.
        Parameters:
        exit - : Element to set

      • GenerateExit

        public void GenerateExit()
        Randomly generates a valid exit for the labyrinth. With the following restrictions: The exit must be on a frontier. The exit must not be on a corner. The coordinates for the generated exit are stored on the exit array.

      • SetChamber

        public void SetChamber()
        Sets the outside walls for the maze.

      • DrawGrid

        public void DrawGrid()
        Draws a grid inside the previously generated maze chamber. Example (5x5): x x x x x x x x x x x x x x x x x x x x x

      • GenerateWalls

        public void GenerateWalls()
        Generates the final maze. Takes our pre-created grid and then randomly opens holes in walls. Follows the backtracking algorithm.

      • hasNeighbor

        public boolean hasNeighbor(int x,
                  int y,
                  int direction)

        public boolean hasUnvisitedNeighbors(int x,
                            int y,
                            boolean[][] visited)
